Detailed Description

Command line argument under the XOR mask.

This class help to specify two or more arguments as a set of arguments in wich only one can be defined in the command line.

Adding required argument under the XOR mask is dissallowed.

QtArgIface * QtXorArg::giveArgument ( const QChar &  flag  )  [inline, virtual]

Should return pointer to the QtArgIface if this argument know how to do it, as usual returns "this" if he does.

Return values:
Pointer to the QtArgIface if flag flag determines this argument.
NULL if flag flag doesn't determine this argument.

Implements QtArgIface.

void QtXorArg::checkConstraint (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Check corrcetness of the argument constraint.

Should throw QtArgContraintNotObservedEx if constraint didn't observed.

Implements QtArgIface.

QString QtXorArg::getUsageString ( const NamesList &  namesList  )  const [inline, virtual]

Should return "USAGE" string for this argument.

For example: "-a%afterFlags%--arg %value%", where "%value%" is QtArgHelpPrinterIface::argValue and "%afterFlags%" is QtArgHelpPrinterIface::afterFlags.

Returns:
"USAGE" string for this argument.
namesList Names of all available arguments.

QString QtXorArg::getHelpString ( const NamesList &  namesList  )  const [inline, virtual]

Should return "HELP" string for this argument.

For spaces you have to use string constants from QtArgHelpPrinterIface interface.

Returns:
"HELP" string for this argument.
namesList Names of all available arguments.
